Table.name: TASK_TASK
Table.commentInRDBMS: Task Definition: A Task Definition is a predefined maintenance task defined against an Assembly log card. A Task Definition can be associated with a Failure Mode as a corrective action to take when the Failure Mode is detected. A task definition is the same as a maintenance requirement - it can be from many sources: Approved Maintenance Program, internal, FAA AD, OEM SB, etc...

Column.name: TASK_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: Identifies the creation database (MIM_LOCAL_DB) of the record and forms part of the record's primary key.

Column.name: TASK_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: Unique ID assigned from Sequence TASK_ID_SEQ

Column.name: ACTV_HR_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to ORG_HR. The person who made the current revision active or obsolete.

Column.name: ACTV_HR_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to ORG_HR. The person who made the current revision active or obsolete.

Column.name: TASK_DEFN_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to TASK_DEFN.

Column.name: TASK_DEFN_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to TASK_DEFN.

Column.name: TASK_CLASS_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_TASK_CLASS. Identifies the class of the task definition, which is used to activate various Maintenix functionality.

Column.name: TASK_CLASS_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_TASK_CLASS. Identifies the class of the task definition, which is used to activate various Maintenix functionality.

Column.name: TASK_PRIORITY_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_TASK_PRIORITY. Identifies the priority of the task definition.

Column.name: TASK_PRIORITY_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_TASK_PRIORITY. Identifies the priority of the task definition.

Column.name: ASSMBL_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to EQP_ASSMBL_BOM

Column.name: ASSMBL_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to EQP_ASSMBL_BOM

Column.name: ASSMBL_BOM_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to EQP_ASSMBL_BOM

Column.name: REPL_ASSMBL_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK EQP_ASSMBL_BOM. Associates a 'Replacement' task definition with tracked bom item.

Column.name: REPL_ASSMBL_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK EQP_ASSMBL_BOM. Associates a 'Replacement' task definition with tracked bom item.

Column.name: REPL_ASSMBL_BOM_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK EQP_ASSMBL_BOM. Associates a 'Replacement' task definition with tracked bom item.

Column.name: TASK_SUBCLASS_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_TASK_SUBCLASS. Identifies the subclass for this task definition, which is used to categorize task definitions and help with reporting.

Column.name: TASK_SUBCLASS_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_TASK_SUBCLASS. Identifies the subclass for this task definition, which is used to categorize task definitions and help with reporting.

Column.name: TASK_ORIGINATOR_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_TASK_ORIGINATOR

Column.name: TASK_ORIGINATOR_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_TASK_ORIGINATOR

Column.name: TASK_DEF_STATUS_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_TASK_DEF_STATUS

Column.name: TASK_DEF_STATUS_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_TASK_DEF_STATUS

Column.name: BITMAP_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: Identifies the creation database (MIM_LOCAL_DB) of the record and forms part of the record's primary key.

Column.name: BITMAP_TAG
Column.commentInRDBMS: Unique idenifier assigned from Sequence BITMAP_TAG_SEQ.

Column.name: TASK_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: A user assigned code that helps identify the maintenance requirement.

Column.name: TASK_NAME
Column.commentInRDBMS: A name used to label the task.

Column.name: TASK_LDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: A long description that defines the task.

Column.name: INSTRUCTION_LDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: A long description (work instructions) of what the task entails.

Column.name: ISSUE_ACCOUNT_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: This is a foreign key to FNC_ACCOUNT. This is optional for all task definitions.

Column.name: ISSUE_ACCOUNT_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: This is a foreign key to FNC_ACCOUNT. This is optional for all task definitions.

Column.name: RECURRING_TASK_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Indicates if the task should be done more than once.

Column.name: USE_SCHED_FROM_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Indicates whether a task initialized from this task definition is to calculate its deadlines using the Schedule From rule or the Reschedule From rule, but only when the task is created by a task with a different definition. If 1 use Schedule From rule, otherwise use Reschedule From rule.

Column.name: SCHED_FROM_LATEST_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Indicating if the system schedules the first Actual Task based on the latest of effective date or manufacture date.

Column.name: MANUAL_SCHEDULING_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Indicates that the scheduling interval should be set by the user on the actual tasks.

Column.name: TASK_APPL_LDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: A long description of the applicability (or effectivity) of the task.

Column.name: TASK_APPL_SQL_LDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: The exact SQL statement that defines the applicability filter.

Column.name: TASK_REF_SDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: A brief description that defines a reference key to access the task (may be a 'lose' IETM' link).

Column.name: EST_DURATION_QT
Column.commentInRDBMS: This is the estimated duration of the task definition (in hours)

Column.name: EFFECTIVE_DT
Column.commentInRDBMS: The date that this task definition was issued by the originating body, and therefore the date that it becomes effective (local time).

Column.name: EFFECTIVE_GDT
Column.commentInRDBMS: The date that this task definition was issued by the originating body, and therefore the date that it becomes effective (GMT time).

Column.name: ROUTINE_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Specifies whether this task is considered "routine" work or not. The routine flag is typically used for reporting purposes.

Column.name: FORECAST_RANGE_QT
Column.commentInRDBMS: This column is used to indicate how many days into the future a recurring task should be forecasted out.

Column.name: MIN_PLAN_YIELD_PCT
Column.commentInRDBMS: This percentage value applied to deadline interval with respect to the task due date indicates a starting point of an optimal planning window. This the threshold at which the task should be scheduled.

Column.name: RESOURCE_SUM_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Specificies whether this Task summarizes the resource requirements of it's sub-Tasks or it contains the resource requirements.

Column.name: REVISION_ORD
Column.commentInRDBMS: Revision number. This field is generated automatically upon creation of a new revision. This is next maximum value in context of the task definition.

Column.name: ACTV_DT
Column.commentInRDBMS: ACTIVATE_DT: The date/time that the task becomes active or obsolete. This field is automatically written when the task definition is made active or obsolete.

Column.name: ACTV_LDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: The description why a task definition revision was made ACTV.

Column.name: ACTV_REF_SDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: The document reference on activation of a task revision.

Column.name: UNIQUE_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: The UNIQUE_BOOL is used to indicate that an inventory cannot have more than one instance of a "active" task based on this task class. "Active" in this case means, not histroic and not FORECAST.

Column.name: WORKSCOPE_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: The WORKSCOPE_BOOL is used to indicate that a task based on this task definition is part of Check/Work Order worscope.

Column.name: AUTO_COMPLETE_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Automatic creation boolean defaults on the value of specified for the task class, after that user will be able to overwrite this value.

Column.name: LAST_SCHED_DEAD_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: A physical attribute that defines the read/write access of the record.

Column.name: TASK_APPL_EFF_LDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: Defines the assembly-inventory this task definition can be created against.

Column.name: ENGINEERING_LDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: Notes recorded only for the benefit of engineering and should be editable upon the creation or editing of a task definition

Column.name: CANCEL_ON_AC_INST_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Boolean flag indicating that this task should be cancelled when inventory is installed onto an aircraft.

Column.name: CANCEL_ON_ANY_INST_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Boolean flag indicating that this task should be cancelled when inventory is installed into any component.

Column.name: CREATE_ON_AC_INST_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Boolean flag indicating that this task should be created when inventory is installed onto an aircraft.

Column.name: CREATE_ON_ANY_INST_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Boolean flag indicating that this task should be created when inventory is installed into any component.

Column.name: CANCEL_ON_AC_RMVL_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Boolean flag indicating that this task should be cancelled when inventory is removed from an aircraft.

Column.name: CANCEL_ON_ANY_RMVL_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Boolean flag indicating that this task should be cancelled when inventory is removed from any component.

Column.name: CREATE_ON_AC_RMVL_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Boolean flag indicating that this task should be created when inventory is removed from an aircraft.

Column.name: CREATE_ON_ANY_RMVL_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Boolean flag indicating that this task should be created when inventory is removed from any component.

Column.name: SOFT_DEADLINE_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: This flag is used it indicate that all deadlines against the task will be considered soft.

Column.name: HARD_DEAD_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: This flag is used to indicate that task scheduling is using CDY hard deadline.

Column.name: EXT_KEY_SDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: A field used to store an external system's PK value.

Column.name: REV_NOTE
Column.commentInRDBMS: This is the revision notes.

Column.name: REV_HR_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: This is a foreign key to the user who created the revision of the task definition.

Column.name: REV_HR_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: This is a foreign key to the user who created the revision of the task definition.

Column.name: REV_DT
Column.commentInRDBMS: This is the date the task definition was put into revision.

Column.name: BLOCK_CHAIN_SDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: This is the name of the block chain that a block is part of. All blocks in the chain share this name.

Column.name: BLOCK_ORD
Column.commentInRDBMS: This is the order of the block in a block chain.

Column.name: INITIAL_BLOCK_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: This indicates that the block is the first block in a chain.

Column.name: ON_CONDITION_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Indicates if this task revision should be instantiated when the parent task revision is instantiated.

Column.name: LOCKED_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: This boolean indicates if the task definition is locked.

Column.name: LOCKED_HR_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: This is the human resource that locked the task definition.

Column.name: LOCKED_HR_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: This is the human resource that locked the task definition.

Column.name: LOCKED_DT
Column.commentInRDBMS: This is the date the task definition was locked.

Column.name: ETOPS_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: True is the task is ETOPS significant.

Column.name: RESCHED_FROM_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: This is a foreign key to the rescheduling rule for recurring actual tasks.

Column.name: APPROVED_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: this boolean defines if this task definition has been approved.

Column.name: MIN_USAGE_RELEASE_PCT
Column.commentInRDBMS: This column is used to indicate the minumum percentage usage that is allowed for the release of inventory

Column.name: ORG_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: organization that task definition belongs to

Column.name: ORG_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: organization that task definition belongs to

Column.name: ENFORCE_WORKSCOPE_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Determines if JIC ordering needs to be enforced for non-executable requirements.

Column.name: ALT_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS:
The alternate key is useful for identifying a specific row in the database when dealing with integrations and Maintenix front ends. The alternate key can is unique to each entity and acts as a surrogate key.

The alternate key is intended to be system generated.

Column.name: TASK_SCHED_FROM_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: This specifies the DB Id.

Column.name: TASK_SCHED_FROM_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: This specifies the task scheduling option.

Column.name: RSTAT_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: A physical attribute that defines the read/write access of the record.

Column.name: CREATION_DT
Column.commentInRDBMS: The database server's timestamp captured at the time the record was inserted.

Column.name: REVISION_DT
Column.commentInRDBMS: The database server's timestamp captured at the time the record was last updated.

Column.name: REVISION_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: The database identifer (MIM_LOCAL_DB) captured at the time the record was last updated. Identifies where modifications are being made in distributed Maintenix.

Column.name: REVISION_USER
Column.commentInRDBMS: The user that last modified the record. The user is either a) the user that logged into Maintenix - pushed into the database from the client or b) if the record update is not via a Maintenix application, the user is the Oracle user name that is processing the transaction.

Column.name: SCHED_UNKNOWN_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Used for reference documents only. When TRUE indicates that scheduled from date for reference document has not been selected.
